text: anyone know how to change axis labels in Dash.jl? Spent 20 minutes or so without resolution

elements.text: anyone know how to change axis labels in Dash.jl? Spent 20 minutes or so without resolution

text:
This site is a pretty helpful resource for styling the axes of the plotly component of dash -- <https://plotly.com/javascript/axes/>

Some example code might look like (adapted from my own codebase, so apologies if it doesn't work, I just deleted a bunch of extraneous stuff):
```xaxis = Dict("tickmode" => "array", "tickvals"=>[1,3,5], "ticktext" => ["label1", "label2","label3"])

return dcc_graph(
 figure = Dict(
    "data" => [ Dict("x" => 1:10, "y" => collect(1:10), "type" => "scatter", "mode" => "lines")], 
    "layout" => Dict("xaxis" => xaxis, "autosize" => true))```
Also the plotly.js reference can give you a sense of what you need to input to Dash.jl: <https://plotly.com/javascript/reference/layout/xaxis/>

attachments.title: Axes
attachments.text: How to adjust axes properties in D3.js-based javascript charts. Seven examples of linear and logarithmic axes, axes titles, and styling and coloring axes and grid lines.

attachments.title: layout.xaxis
attachments.text: Figure attribute reference for Plotly's JavaScript open-source graphing library.
